description.narrative: DRRR / Emergency Response, which contributes to Access To Justice, Access To Justice (Covid), Cross-Sectoral Communication For Development, Prevention And Response Services For Violence Against Children, Prevention And Response Services For Violence Against Children (Covid), Supply And Logistics, Supply And Logistics (Covid). UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, United Nations Working Together. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2022, girls, boys and women nationally have increased access to and utilize preventive and responsive protection services that promote their safety, well-being and access to justice.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

description.narrative: During the reporting period, UNICEF continued its support to Government in child protection in emergencies, including supporting the Government of Papua New Guinea to ensure that child protection and the prevention and response to violence against children is at the forefront of, and streamlined into, the emergency response to the COVID-19 global pandemic. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:07/08/2020
